com.github.brunothg.game.engine.d2.commons

Class RenderingOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractMap<K,V>
      • java.util.HashMap<RenderingHints.Key,Object>
        • com.github.brunothg.game.engine.d2.commons.RenderingOptions
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, Cloneable, Map<RenderingHints.Key,Object>

    public class RenderingOptions
extends HashMap<RenderingHints.Key,Object>
    A class holding several rendering settings, that can be used for configuring Graphics2D objects. Most methods can be used like a builder class.
    Author:
    Marvin Bruns
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • put

        public Object put(RenderingHints.Key key,
         Object value)
        Set the rendering state for RenderingHints.Key. Only values accepted by this RenderingHints.Key are allowed.
        Specified by:
        put in interface Map<RenderingHints.Key,Object>
        Overrides:
        put in class HashMap<RenderingHints.Key,Object>
        Parameters:
        key - The rendering option, that should be configured
        value - The configuration value for the given option
        See Also:
        RenderingHints.Key.isCompatibleValue(Object)

      • setAntiAliasing

        public RenderingOptions setAntiAliasing(Boolean on)
        Sets the anti aliasing option. If null is passed, the default behavior will be activated.
        Parameters:
        on - The anti aliasing status used.
        See Also:
        RenderingHints.KEY_ANTIALIASING

      • setAntiAliasingForText

        public RenderingOptions setAntiAliasingForText(Boolean on)
        Sets the anti aliasing option for text drawing. If null is passed, the default behavior will be activated. More options may be available using put method.
        Parameters:
        on - The anti aliasing status used.
        See Also:
        RenderingHints.KEY_TEXT_ANTIALIASING

      • setFractionalMetrics

        public RenderingOptions setFractionalMetrics(Boolean on)
        Sets the fractional metrics option. If null is passed, the default behavior will be activated.
        Parameters:
        on - The fractional metrics status used.
        See Also:
        RenderingHints.KEY_FRACTIONALMETRICS

      • setStrokeControl

        public RenderingOptions setStrokeControl(Boolean on)
        Sets the stroke control option. If null is passed, the default behavior will be activated. If true, strokes will be normalized.
        Parameters:
        on - The stroke control status used.
        See Also:
        RenderingHints.KEY_STROKE_CONTROL

      • setDithering

        public RenderingOptions setDithering(Boolean on)
        Sets the dithering option. If null is passed, the default behavior will be activated.
        Parameters:
        on - The dithering status used.
        See Also:
        RenderingHints.KEY_DITHERING

      • setEnhancedColorRednering

        public RenderingOptions setEnhancedColorRednering(Boolean on)
        Sets the enhanced color rendering option. If null is passed, the default behavior will be activated. If true, the color rendering will try to produce the best possible result, but may be much slower.
        Parameters:
        on - The enhanced status status used.
        See Also:
        RenderingHints.KEY_COLOR_RENDERING

      • setEnhancedRednering

        public RenderingOptions setEnhancedRednering(Boolean on)
        Sets the enhanced rendering option. If null is passed, the default behavior will be activated. If true, the rendering will try to produce the best possible result, but may be much slower.
        Parameters:
        on - The enhanced status status used.
        See Also:
        RenderingHints.KEY_RENDERING

      • setEnhancedInterpolation

        public RenderingOptions setEnhancedInterpolation(Boolean on)
        Sets the enhanced interpolation option. If null is passed, the default behavior will be activated. If true, the interpolation will try to produce the best possible result, but may be much slower.
        Parameters:
        on - The enhanced status status used.
        See Also:
        RenderingHints.KEY_INTERPOLATION

      • setEnhancedAlphaInterpolation

        public RenderingOptions setEnhancedAlphaInterpolation(Boolean on)
        Sets the enhanced alpha interpolation option. If null is passed, the default behavior will be activated. If true, the alpha interpolation will try to produce the best possible result, but may be much slower.
        Parameters:
        on - The enhanced status status used.
        See Also:
        RenderingHints.KEY_ALPHA_INTERPOLATION

      • setTextLcdContrast

        public RenderingOptions setTextLcdContrast(int contrast)
        Controls the LCD contrast level.
        Parameters:
        contrast - The used contrast level
        See Also:
        RenderingHints.KEY_TEXT_LCD_CONTRAST

      • apply

        public RenderingOptions apply(Graphics g)
        Apply this rendering settings to an Graphics object. Previous options will remain and aren't overwritten.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object used for configuration purpose
        See Also:
        apply(Graphics,boolean)

      • apply

        public RenderingOptions apply(Graphics g,
                     boolean fullyReplace)
        Apply this rendering settings to an Graphics object. This will try to cast it to a Graphics2D object, as only this will support those settings.
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object used for configuration purpose
        fullyReplace - If true, all options set before will be discarded
        See Also:
        apply(Graphics2D,boolean)

      • apply

        public RenderingOptions apply(Graphics2D g,
                     boolean fullyReplace)
        Apply this rendering settings to an Graphics2D object. Behaves like Graphics2D.addRenderingHints(java.util.Map).
        Parameters:
        g - The Graphics object used for configuration purpose
        fullyReplace - If true, all options set before will be discarded
